checkin.thankYou: Thank you! Your family will see this.

activity.title: Today's Activity
activity.comeBackLater: Check back tomorrow for a new activity!
activity.defaultFollowUp: What a wonderful memory! Thank you for sharing.

activities.title: Activities
activities.subtitle: Choose something enjoyable to do
activities.todaysActivityDesc: A special activity chosen for you

remember.title: Remember
remember.childhoodPrompt: What was it like growing up in {{text}}?
remember.careerPrompt: Tell me about your time working as {{text}}
remember.photoPrompt: What does this photo remind you of?
remember.followUp: What a wonderful memory! Thank you for sharing.
remember.noPrompts: Your family is adding memories for you

listen.title: Listen to Music
listen.followUp: Music is wonderful! Thank you for listening.

move.title: Move
move.prompt1: Stretch your arms up high, then slowly bring them down. Repeat 5 times.
move.prompt2: Stand up and sit down slowly, 5 times. Hold the chair for support.
move.prompt3: Roll your shoulders forwards 5 times, then backwards 5 times.
move.prompt4: March on the spot for 30 seconds. Lift your knees as high as comfortable.
move.prompt5: Gently turn your head left, then right, then look up and down. Repeat 3 times.
move.followUp: Well done! Moving your body is wonderful for you.

create.title: Create
create.prompt1: Draw or describe your favourite place in the world.
create.prompt2: If you could paint the sky any colour, what would you choose and why?
create.prompt3: Describe a meal you love. What does it smell like? What does it taste like?
create.prompt4: Tell a story about a happy day you remember.
create.followUp: How creative! Thank you for sharing.

common.thankYouSharing: Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

wordAssociation.title: Word Association
wordAssociation.description: Say the first word that comes to mind
wordAssociation.instruction: Look at the word below. What is the first word that comes to your mind?
wordAssociation.sayWord: Say the word out loud, or think of one in your head. Take your time!

oddWordOut.title: Odd Word Out
oddWordOut.description: Find the word that doesn't belong
oddWordOut.instruction: Which word does not belong with the others?

explain.fruitNotFurniture: Apple and Banana are fruits — a Chair is furniture.
explain.animalsNotFurniture: Cat and Dog are animals — a Table is furniture.
explain.colorsNotTool: Red and Blue are colours — a Hammer is a tool.
explain.flowersNotClothing: Rose and Daisy are flowers — a Shoe is clothing.
explain.drinksNotStationery: Milk and Juice are drinks — a Pencil is stationery.
explain.vehiclesNotCutlery: Car and Bus are vehicles — a Spoon is cutlery.
explain.clothingNotAnimal: Hat and Glove are clothing — a Fish is an animal.
explain.bakedNotObject: Bread and Cake are baked goods — a Clock is an object.
explain.instrumentsNotBedding: Piano and Guitar are instruments — a Pillow is bedding.
explain.skyNotKitchen: Sun and Moon are in the sky — a Kettle is in the kitchen.
explain.clothingNotLight: Shirt and Trousers are clothing — a Lamp gives light.
explain.foodNotVehicle: Egg and Cheese are food — a Bicycle is a vehicle.
explain.cutleryNotAnimal: Fork and Knife are cutlery — a Rabbit is an animal.
explain.bodyNotHouse: Hand and Foot are body parts — a Window is part of a house.
explain.seasonsNotObject: Spring and Autumn are seasons — a Cup is an object.
explain.animalsNotObject: Horse and Cow are animals — an Umbrella is an object.
explain.jobsNotFood: Doctor and Teacher are jobs — a Carrot is food.
explain.waterNotFurniture: River and Lake are water — a Sofa is furniture.
explain.royaltyNotFood: King and Queen are royalty — a Potato is food.
explain.sportsNotTool: Football and Tennis are sports — a Ladder is a tool.
explain.fruitNotVeg: Apple, Banana and Orange are fruits — a Carrot is a vegetable.
explain.birdsNotFish: Eagle, Robin and Sparrow are birds — a Salmon is a fish.
explain.instrumentsNotArt: Violin, Trumpet and Drum are instruments — a Painting is art.
explain.citiesNotDay: London, Paris and Rome are cities — Tuesday is a day.
explain.treesNotFurniture: Oak, Pine and Birch are trees — a Desk is furniture.
explain.fabricsNotPaper: Cotton, Wool and Silk are fabrics — Paper is not.
explain.shapesNotFeeling: Circle, Square and Triangle are shapes — Happy is a feeling.
explain.mealsNotActivity: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner are meals — Sleep is an activity.
explain.monthsNotDay: January, March and June are months — Friday is a day.
explain.exerciseNotReading: Swimming, Running and Cycling are exercise — Reading is not.
explain.metalsNotWood: Gold, Silver and Bronze are metals — Wood is not.
explain.toolsNotPlant: Hammer, Saw and Drill are tools — a Flower is a plant.
explain.bodyNotObject: Thumb, Elbow and Knee are body parts — a Pencil is an object.
explain.weatherNotFood: Rain, Snow and Wind are weather — Bread is food.
explain.currencyNotMeasure: Dollar, Pound and Euro are currency — a Metre is measurement.
explain.planetsNotDay: Mars, Venus and Jupiter are planets — Monday is a day.
explain.jobsNotObject: Nurse, Pilot and Teacher are jobs — a Pencil is an object.
explain.foodNotFurniture: Soup, Salad and Sandwich are food — a Chair is furniture.
explain.faceNotShoe: Eye, Ear and Nose are on the face — a Boot is a shoe.
explain.animalsNotFlower: Tiger, Lion and Bear are animals — a Tulip is a flower.

priceGuessing.title: Price Guessing
priceGuessing.description: Guess how much everyday items cost
priceGuessing.goodTry: Good try! Prices can be tricky.

sorting.title: Sorting
sorting.description: Sort items into the right groups
sorting.instruction: Sort these items into two groups!
sorting.tapItem: Tap an item, then tap a group
sorting.tapCategory: Now tap a group to sort it

putInOrder.title: Put in Order
putInOrder.description: Put the steps in the right order
putInOrder.instruction: Tap each step in the right order

steps.putTeaBag: Put a tea bag in the cup

pairMatching.title: Pair Matching
pairMatching.instruction: Tap cards to find matching pairs!

soundId.title: Sound Identification
soundId.description: Can you guess what makes this sound?

history.title: This Day in History
history.description: Discover what happened on this day
history.typeThoughts: What do you think about this?

facts.haitiIndependence: Haiti became the first country to abolish slavery and declare independence.
facts.mlkBorn: Martin Luther King Jr. was born in Atlanta, Georgia.
facts.columbiaShuttle: The Space Shuttle Columbia broke apart during re-entry.
facts.bellTelephone: Alexander Graham Bell patented the telephone.
facts.womensDay: The first International Women's Day was celebrated.
facts.stPatrick: Saint Patrick, patron saint of Ireland, passed away.
facts.appleFounded: Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak founded Apple Computer.
facts.titanicSank: The Titanic sank after hitting an iceberg.
facts.greatExhibition: The Great Exhibition opened at the Crystal Palace in London.
facts.veDay: Victory in Europe Day — the end of World War II in Europe.
facts.queenCoronation: Queen Elizabeth II was crowned at Westminster Abbey.
facts.dDay: D-Day — Allied forces landed on the beaches of Normandy.
facts.moonLanding: Neil Armstrong became the first person to walk on the Moon.
facts.worldWideWeb: The World Wide Web was made available to the public.
facts.woodstock: The Woodstock music festival began in New York.
facts.wwiiStart: World War II began when Germany invaded Poland.
facts.firstRailway: The world's first public railway opened in England.
facts.disneyWorld: Walt Disney World opened its doors in Florida.
facts.reformation: Martin Luther posted his 95 Theses, starting the Reformation.
facts.berlinWall: The Berlin Wall fell, reuniting East and West Germany.
facts.armistice: World War I ended with the signing of the Armistice.
facts.rosaParks: Rosa Parks refused to give up her bus seat in Alabama.
facts.williamCrowned: William the Conqueror was crowned King of England.
facts.fordWages: Henry Ford announced a $5-per-day minimum wage for workers.
facts.elizabethII: Elizabeth II became Queen of the United Kingdom.
facts.gandhiSaltMarch: Mahatma Gandhi began the Salt March in India.
facts.firstEarthDay: The first Earth Day was celebrated worldwide.
facts.everestClimbed: Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay reached the summit of Everest.
facts.victoriaQueen: Queen Victoria ascended to the British throne.
facts.bastilleDay: The storming of the Bastille began the French Revolution.
facts.faradayBorn: Michael Faraday, pioneer of electricity, was born.
facts.soundBarrier: Chuck Yeager became the first person to break the sound barrier.
facts.jfkAssassination: President John F. Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas.
facts.wrightBrothers: The Wright Brothers made the first powered flight.

starryNight.title: The Starry Night
starryNight.description: A swirling night sky over a small village with a bright crescent moon and glowing stars.

waterLilies.title: Water Lilies
waterLilies.description: A peaceful pond with floating water lilies and reflections of willows.

sunflowers.title: Sunflowers
sunflowers.description: A vase of bright yellow sunflowers against a warm background.

girlPearl.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
girlPearl.description: A young girl looking over her shoulder wearing a blue and gold turban and a pearl earring.

theScream.title: The Scream
theScream.description: A figure with an agonised expression against a tumultuous orange sky.

greatWave.title: The Great Wave
greatWave.description: A massive wave with white foam curling over small boats, Mount Fuji in the background.

monaLisa.title: Mona Lisa
monaLisa.description: A woman with a mysterious smile seated against a distant landscape.

poppy.title: Poppy Field
poppy.description: A sunny meadow dotted with red poppies, figures walking through the grass.

balletDancers.title: The Ballet Class
balletDancers.description: Young ballet dancers practising in a bright studio with their teacher.

nightCafe.title: The Night Café
nightCafe.description: The inside of a café at night with bright lamps and a billiard table.

haystacks.title: Haystacks
haystacks.description: Golden haystacks in a field catching the light of the setting sun.

umbrellas.title: The Umbrellas
umbrellas.description: A crowd of people with umbrellas on a rainy Parisian street.

bridge.title: The Japanese Bridge
bridge.description: A curved green bridge over a lily pond surrounded by weeping willows.

irises.title: Irises
irises.description: A bed of purple irises with one white iris standing out among them.

persistence.title: The Persistence of Memory
persistence.description: Melting clocks draped over objects in a dreamlike desert landscape.

luncheon.title: Luncheon of the Boating Party
luncheon.description: Friends enjoying lunch on a sunny balcony overlooking a river.

boating.title: Boating
boating.description: A man and woman in a small sailboat on bright blue water.

impression.title: Impression, Sunrise
impression.description: A hazy harbour scene at dawn with a bright orange sun reflecting on water.

cottages.title: Cottages at Cordeville
cottages.description: Charming thatched cottages with a dramatic swirling sky above.

snowScene.title: The Magpie
snowScene.description: A quiet winter scene with snow-covered fields and a magpie on a fence.

trueOrFalse.title: True or False
trueOrFalse.description: Is this statement true or false?

statements.sunSetsWest: The sun sets in the west.
statements.moonMadeCheese: The Moon is made of cheese.
statements.greatWallChina: The Great Wall of China is over 13,000 miles long.
statements.lightningSoundFirst: We hear thunder before we see lightning.
statements.olympicsEvery4Years: The Summer Olympics happen every four years.
statements.saharaLargestDesert: The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.
statements.diamondHardest: Diamond is the hardest natural material.
statements.nileAfrica: The Nile is a river in Africa.
statements.australiaContinent: Australia is both a country and a continent.
statements.veniceBuiltWater: Venice is a city built on water.
statements.coinTossWeighted: A coin toss always lands on heads.
statements.eiffelTowerLondon: The Eiffel Tower is in London.
statements.chocolateFromBeans: Chocolate is made from cocoa beans.

explanations.earthRound: Yes! The Earth is a sphere, slightly flattened at the poles.
explanations.sunSetsWest: That's right! The sun always sets in the west.
explanations.fishCanFly: Fish live in water and cannot fly (though some can leap!)
explanations.bananaBlue: Bananas are yellow (or green when unripe).
explanations.penguinBird: Penguins are indeed birds, though they cannot fly.
explanations.snowHot: Snow is cold — it's frozen water crystals!
explanations.moonMadeCheese: The Moon is made of rock and dust!
explanations.roseIsFlower: Yes! A rose is one of the most popular flowers.
explanations.catsHaveWings: Cats have four legs but no wings!
explanations.parisInFrance: Paris is the capital city of France.
explanations.horsesHaveLegs: Yes, horses stand on four strong legs.
explanations.treesAreGreen: Most tree leaves are green due to chlorophyll.
explanations.carsCanFly: Regular cars drive on roads — they cannot fly.
explanations.iceIsFrozenWater: Correct! Ice is water frozen below 0°C.
explanations.elephantsSmall: Elephants are the largest land animals!
explanations.milkFromCows: Yes! Most milk we drink comes from cows.
explanations.greatWallChina: It's the longest wall ever built!
explanations.lightningSoundFirst: We see lightning first because light travels faster than sound.
explanations.olympicsEvery4Years: The Summer Olympics are held every four years.
explanations.saharaLargestDesert: The Sahara stretches across most of North Africa.
explanations.spidersAreInsects: Spiders are arachnids — they have 8 legs, not 6!
explanations.diamondHardest: Diamond is the hardest natural substance known.
explanations.tomatoVegetable: A tomato is actually a fruit!
explanations.nileAfrica: The Nile flows through northeastern Africa.
explanations.australiaContinent: Australia is both a country and the smallest continent.
explanations.veniceBuiltWater: Venice, Italy is built on over 100 small islands.
explanations.honeyNeverExpires: Honey found in ancient tombs was still edible!
explanations.goldfishMemory3s: Goldfish can actually remember things for months!
explanations.octopus3Hearts: An octopus has three hearts — two for gills, one for the body.
explanations.sunIsStar: The Sun is a medium-sized star at the centre of our solar system.
explanations.bambooFastGrowing: Some bamboo can grow up to 91cm in a single day!
explanations.coinTossWeighted: A fair coin has an equal chance of heads or tails.
explanations.bearsSleepWinter: Bears hibernate through winter to conserve energy.
explanations.eiffelTowerLondon: The Eiffel Tower is in Paris, France!
explanations.chocolateFromBeans: Chocolate is made from roasted cocoa beans.
